intro: [WRONG START] Embilia pergamacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf embelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds. Embelia pergamacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
